intro: Astragalus diyarbakirensis, commonly known as the Diyarbakır milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the summer months. It is typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
